intro: Suaeda tortuosa, commonly known as the twisted saltbush, is a halophytic shrub native to arid and coastal regions of the Mediterranean and Middle East. It is characterized by its succulent, fleshy leaves that store water, aiding in survival in saline and drought-prone environments. The plant produces small, yellowish flowers that bloom in summer, typically in clusters at the ends of branches. Its root system is deep and robust, allowing it to access groundwater in nutrient-poor soils. Suaeda tortuosa plays a vital role in stabilizing coastal dunes and preventing soil erosion.
